detaileddescription.para: For example, the MODULE_IDX(buttons) can be used to get module index of module named buttons.
For example, the MODULE_ID(buttons) can be used to get module ID of module named buttons.
Module is active. This state is reported when the module is initialized or woken up after suspending.
Module is suspended in reaction to power_down_event. The module cannot submit wake_up_event.
Module is suspended in reaction to power_down_event. The module can submit wake_up_event.
Unused in code, required for inter-core compatibility.

briefdescription.para: Get ID of module with given index.
Get IDX of module with given id.
Get name of the module with given id.
Check if given module index is valid.

parameterdescription.para: Index is out of valid range.

briefdescription.para: Check if there is 0 in all the flags.

parameterdescription.para: All the flags have value of 0.
Any of the flags is not 0.
The index of the selected module.
The module bit in flags is set.
The module bit in flags is cleared.
The index of the selected module.
The index of the selected module.

briefdescription.para: Set single module bit to specified value.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the selected module.
The value to be set in a specified module's bit.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct module_state_event *event, const void *module_id, enum module_state state)
memberdef.name: check_state

briefdescription.para: Check if the selected module reported the selected state.

detaileddescription.para: The function can be used in event handler to verify if received module state event informs that selected module reported selected state. The MODULE_ID can be used to get module ID of module with selected name.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handled module state event.
The module state event informs that selected module reported selected state. Otherwise, false is returned.

briefdescription.para: Submit module state event to inform that state of the module changed.

detaileddescription.para: ID of the module is automatically assigned based on name that is defined as MODULE.
